title: Advanced Routing Protocols (RIP, OSPF, BGP)
subject: Computer Networks
theory:
- **OSPF (IGP)**: Open Shortest Path First. Fast, uses Dijkstra. Internal to org.
- **BGP (EGP)**: Border Gateway Protocol. Routing between ISPs (The Internet's protocol). Policy based.

interview_questions.question: Why BGP is slow?
interview_questions.answer: Designed for stability and policy, not speed. Prevents route flapping worldwide.

real_world_use_cases.description: Bad BGP update disconnected FB from the internet.
